newsitem.title: HONG KONG: S'hai Hai Xing up on asset injection hope.
newsitem.headline: S'hai Hai Xing up on asset injection hope.

text.p: Shares of Shanghai Hai Xing Shipping Co Ltd surged on hopes of asset injections following Shanghai Industrial Holdings Ltd's purchase of assets earlier this week, brokers said on Friday.
"Renewed speculation of possible asset injections fueled demand for the stock," said Anthony Mak, sales director at Vickers Ballas.
The company shares rose HK$0.22 or 24.18 percent to HK$1.13 in late trade on volume of 200.36 million shares.
An analyst at a local brokerage said talk that the company might be under some kind of business restructuring which might lead to a possible purchase of asset also fueled demand.
Company officials were not immediately available for comment.
Brokers said investors were also seen buying the stock ahead of the release of its final results due on Wednesday.
Shanghai Industrial earlier this week said it would by a 35 percent stake in two roads in Shanghai for US$600 million, which would be financed by the issue of 139.47 million new shares.
Shanghai Industrial shares rose HK$1.70 to HK$37.50 in late trade.
Shenzhen municipal government-backed Shum Yip Investment Ltd also rose HK$0.35 to HK$4.95.
